decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence and applying pressure to the opponent. It utilizes a combination of efficient creatures, removal spells, and planeswalkers to both control the board and deal damage. The key concept of the deck is to utilize the synergy between cards that generate value and those that provide board control, allowing the player to maintain a strong position while continuing to develop their board. The inclusion of both Nahiri, the Harbinger and Chandra, Flamecaller indicates that the deck also aims to have some versatility and potential for game-changing plays.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on using a combination of powerful creatures like Kalitas and Dragonlord Silumgar, along with versatile spells like Transgress the Mind and Ruinous Path, to control the board and outvalue opponents. The deck also includes a mix of card draw and burn spells to maintain card advantage and deal with threats efficiently. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color requirements, with a mix of dual lands and fetch lands for consistency in casting spells on curve.

The main concept of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence with strong creatures like Archangel Avacyn and Sylvan Advocate, while also using cards like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Nissa, Voice of Zendikar to generate tokens and buff the team. The deck aims to apply pressure early on and maintain control of the board with removal spells such as Dromoka's Command and Tragic Arrogance. The inclusion of Evolutionary Leap and Oath of Nissa provide card advantage and help ensure a consistent flow of threats.

This deck is focused on quickly flooding the board with powerful creatures and utilizing anthem effects from planeswalkers like Nissa and Gideon to overwhelm the opponent. Cards like Hangarback Walker and Sylvan Advocate offer early game threats, while Archangel Avacyn provides protection and a powerful late-game presence. Dromoka's Command and Stasis Snare provide removal and disruption to clear the way for aggressive attacks. The deck also includes some card draw and ramp with Thraben Inspector and Oath of Nissa, while Secure the Wastes and Westvale Abbey offer alternative win conditions if the board gets stalled.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up with Cryptolith Rite and mana dorks to cast Collected Company and flood the board with value creatures like Catacomb Sifter and Duskwatch Recruiter. Utilizing the Eldrazi Displacer for removal and additional value, alongside Zulaport Cutthroat for potential life drain, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. Westvale Abbey provides a potential game-ending threat, while the mana base ensures consistent access to the necessary colors for spells.

The deck focuses on generating value through sacrificing creatures, enabling a strong aggressive strategy with strong synergy between creatures that create tokens, creatures that benefit from sacrifice effects, and cards that allow for additional creature summoning. It aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of creature swarm and direct damage, utilizing sacrifice outlets like Nantuko Husk and Zulaport Cutthroat to close out games quickly. The deck is designed to maintain a constant stream of threats while disrupting the opponent's game plan through constant pressure and efficient creature interactions.

This deck focuses on using a variety of removal spells and efficient threats to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By leveraging powerful planeswalkers like Chandra and Jace, along with versatile creatures like Kalitas and Goblin Dark-Dwellers, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage. Additionally, the deck includes a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw effects to ensure that it can handle a wide range of threats and maintain control of the battlefield.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of cheap and efficient white creatures. By playing aggressive creatures like Dragon Hunter and Town Gossipmonger early on, the deck aims to quickly build a board presence and apply pressure to the opponent. Cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Always Watching help to pump up the team and make the creatures even more threatening. Gideon and Kytheon provide additional support and flexibility, while Declaration in Stone helps to deal with any opposing threats. The deck aims to win by staying ahead on board presence and pressuring the opponent into submission.

This deck focuses on generating value through creature synergies and token production. By combining cards like Cryptolith Rite, Collected Company, and Eldrazi Displacer, it aims to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of creatures. Zulaport Cutthroat provides an additional win condition by draining the opponent's life total. With a mix of ramp, card draw, and disruptive creatures like Reflector Mage, the deck aims to outpace the opponent with its aggressive playstyle. The deck's mana base supports its color requirements while also providing the option to transform Westvale Abbey for a powerful finish.

The deck focuses on quickly playing creatures and controlling the board with spells like Collected Company, Ojutai's Command, and Dromoka's Command. This allows for aggressive plays while maintaining versatility and options for dealing with threats. By utilizing cards like Jace, Vryn's Prodigy and Eldrazi Displacer, the deck can generate card advantage and disrupt opponents' plans. The deck's consistency is enhanced by cards like Sylvan Advocate and Tireless Tracker, while also having access to powerful removal with Reflector Mage. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast, aggressive strategy combined with control elements.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and combat tricks in order to quickly establish a dominant board presence and put pressure on the opponent's life total. The deck aims to utilize cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Collected Company to quickly build a wide board of creatures and use cards like Reflector Mage and Dromoka's Command to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By maintaining a steady stream of threats and disruption, the deck can quickly close out games before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on generating a large number of creatures quickly to overwhelm the opponent, utilizing cards like Cryptolith Rite to ramp up mana production and Collected Company to bring out multiple creatures at once. The key strategy is to sacrifice creatures like Brood Monitor and Eldrazi Displacer to Nantuko Husk or Zulaport Cutthroat to drain the opponent's life points while maintaining board presence. The deck also includes cards like Duskwatch Recruiter and Elvish Visionary for card draw and additional creature generation. Overall, the deck aims to win through aggressive creature-based strategies and efficient resource management.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Explosive Vegetation and Hedron Archive to cast powerful green spells and creatures. It also utilizes cards like Traverse the Ulvenwald and Ruin in Their Wake to search for specific lands to further enhance its ramping ability. The deck aims to control the board and disrupt opponents with cards like Chandra, Flamecaller and Dragonlord Atarka, while ultimately ending the game with massive threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck is built to overwhelm opponents with its high-powered green spells and creatures.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with powerful creatures like Nissa, Voice of Zendikar and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar, while providing support with cards like Hangarback Walker and Sylvan Advocate. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures and utilize cards like Secure the Wastes to create an army of tokens. With additional removal spells like Declaration in Stone and Dromoka's Command, as well as the ability to flip Archangel Avacyn for protection, this deck aims to be a fast and aggressive force on the battlefield.

This deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent by playing efficient and powerful creatures like Nissa, Voice of Zendikar and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar. It also includes removal spells like Declaration in Stone and Stasis Snare to deal with any threats the opponent may play. The deck aims to build a wide board presence and overwhelm the opponent with tokens from cards like Hangarback Walker and Secure the Wastes. The mana base is optimized for consistent mana production for the aggressive creatures and spells.

The Sultai Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful removal spells and disruption to control the game while generating card advantage through cards like Seasons Past and Dark Petition. The deck utilizes a mix of creature threats like Sylvan Advocate and Kalitas, Traitor of Ghet, as well as planeswalkers like Jace, Vryn's Prodigy to close out the game. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color requirements while also providing enough consistency to cast its spells. Overall, the deck aims to grind out opponents through attrition and outvalue them in the late game.
